statement.p: The length of the near field of an ultrasonic tester is given by \displaystyle{L}=\frac{{D}^{{2}}}{{{4}\lambda}} where \displaystyle{D} is the diameter of the transducer (depends on crystal size) and \displaystyle\lambda is the wavelength.

If we want the near field length to be \displaystyle{L}={0.00000002644} meters and we want to use the frequency with wavelength \displaystyle\lambda={614.28571428571} cycles per meter in brass, what diameter in centimeters do we need?
